author: sky.cactus
content: So far I haven't seen any objection.  This is largely because people *want* someone to take care of them.

author: sky.cactus
content: Even in countries where the interventions were totally worthless and in some cases harmful, the people still feel happy that their government is protecting them.

author: sky.cactus
content: In my local country, for example, the protections are definitely hurting more than helping.  The canonical example is reducing the hours of establishments, which means people are bunching up around shorter hours.

author: sky.cactus
content: So instead of grocery shopping for the whole population being spread out across 24 hours a day, it is all concentrated into a government mandated 16 hour window.

author: sky.cactus
content: Yet, people praise the government for protecting them, and ask for even more protections.

author: sky.cactus
content: Even if we assume that Singapore's government is legitimately trying to stop the virus and not just seize power, and we believe that they are generally competent in this endeavor, the core of the problem here is that people are giving up freedom in exchange for protection.  It is this mentality that has lead to pretty much every major atrocity in history.  This is the piece that scares me more than anything else.

author: sky.cactus
content: Even in the face of a global pandemic that threatens to wipe out 90% of humanity, I would *still* like to see people fighting back against someone taking away their freedom.

author: sky.cactus
content: Part of this is because I think humans generally will do fine on their own.  If the pandemic turns out to be truly devastating (e.g., plague) people will "figure it out" without government involvement, though perhaps it will take them a bit longer.  However, they won't give up any ground to authoritarianism which is *incredibly* valuable for society overall and in the long term.  So while we may lose 1/3 of the human population short term, I think the long term gains from not giving up ground to authoritarianism is worth such a loss.
